Package com.alexandriasoftware.swing

Class NonVerifyingValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.InputVerifier
      • com.alexandriasoftware.swing.JInputValidator
        • com.alexandriasoftware.swing.NonVerifyingValidator
  • public abstract class NonVerifyingValidator
extends JInputValidator
    A JInputValidator that always returns true for InputVerifier.verify(javax.swing.JComponent).
    Author:
    Randall Wood

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      NonVerifyingValidator​(JComponent component)
      Create a NonVerifyingValidator with the default preferences.
      NonVerifyingValidator​(JComponent component, boolean onInput)
      Create a NonVerifyingValidator with the default preferences.
      NonVerifyingValidator​(JComponent component, boolean onInput, JInputValidatorPreferences preferences)
      Create a NonVerifyingValidator with custom preferences.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean verify​(JComponent input)
      This implementation, besides verifying if focus can change, redraws the component with a re-evaluated validation state.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NonVerifyingValidator

        public NonVerifyingValidator​(JComponent component)
        Create a NonVerifyingValidator with the default preferences. The validator created with this call listens to all changes to the component if the component is a JTextComponent.
        Parameters:
        component - the component to attach the validator to

      • NonVerifyingValidator

        public NonVerifyingValidator​(JComponent component,
                             boolean onInput)
        Create a NonVerifyingValidator with the default preferences.
        Parameters:
        component - the component to attach the validator to
        onInput - true if validator to validate on all input; false to validate only on focus change; note this has no effect if component is not a JTextComponent

      • NonVerifyingValidator

        public NonVerifyingValidator​(JComponent component,
                             boolean onInput,
                             JInputValidatorPreferences preferences)
        Create a NonVerifyingValidator with custom preferences.
        Parameters:
        component - the component to attach the validator to
        onInput - true if validator to validate on all input; false to validate only on focus change; note this has no effect if component is not a JTextComponent
        preferences - the custom preferences

    • Method Detail

      • verify

        public boolean verify​(JComponent input)
        This implementation, besides verifying if focus can change, redraws the component with a re-evaluated validation state. The validation state can be retrieved afterwards using JInputValidator.getValidation(). This implementation always returns true.
        Overrides:
        verify in class JInputValidator
        Returns:
        false if Validation.getType() equals Validation.Type.DANGER or Validation.Type.WARNING; otherwise returns true
